item.title: Trump plans to start notifying countries of U.S. tariffs up to 70%
item.description: Trump told reporters that about “10 or 12” letters would go out Friday, with additional letters coming “over the next few days.”

item.title: Democratic Congressman Suozzi’s $50,000 stock sale took advantage of a loophole in Congressional disclosure rules
item.description: The New York rep never disclosed owning the stock, prompting the question of how he managed to sell a security he didn’t appear to own in the first pl...

item.title: Thinking about buying an EV? Most are set to become $7,500 more expensive come October
item.description: Carmakers may begin reducing production volumes now in order not to be stuck with excess inventory after September, so buyers only have weeks left to ...

item.title: An over-employed engineer was caught secretly working for multiple Silicon Valley startups at once—picking up salary offers of up to $200K per job
item.description: The saga began on Wednesday when the engineer started going viral on social media as startup founders discovered he had worked for multiple companies.

item.title: Microsoft suspends 3,000 Outlook and Hotmail accounts created by North Korean IT workers
item.description: The company said it discovered a repository of resumes and email accounts the workers are using to apply for jobs.
